segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 7. Migajālavagga
segments.en: 7. With Migajāla

segments.pli: 69. Upasenaāsīvisasutta
segments.en: 69. Upasena and the Viper

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca upaseno rājagahe viharanti sītavane sappasoṇḍikapabbhāre.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Sāriputta and Upasena were staying near Rājagaha in the Cool Wood, under the Snake’s Hood Grotto.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upasenassa kāye āsīviso patito hoti.
segments.en: Now at that time a viper fell on Upasena’s body,

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upaseno bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: and he addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “etha me, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ mañcakaṃ āropetvā bahiddhā nīharatha.
segments.en: “Come, reverends, lift this body onto a cot and carry it outside

segments.pli: Purāyaṃ kāyo idheva vikirati;
segments.en: before it’s scattered right here

segments.pli: seyyathāpi bhusamuṭṭhī”ti.
segments.en: like a handful of chaff.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Sāriputta said to him,

segments.pli: “na kho pana mayaṃ passāma āyasmato upasenassa kāyassa vā aññathattaṃ indriyānaṃ vā vipariṇāmaṃ.
segments.en: “But we don’t see any impairment in your body or deterioration of your faculties.

segments.pli: Atha ca panāyasmā upaseno evamāha:
segments.en: Yet you say:

segments.pli: ‘etha me, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ mañcakaṃ āropetvā bahiddhā nīharatha.
segments.en: ‘Come, reverends, lift this body onto a cot and carry it outside

segments.pli: Purāyaṃ kāyo idheva vikirati;
segments.en: before it’s scattered right here

segments.pli: seyyathāpi bhusamuṭṭhī’”ti.
segments.en: like a handful of chaff.’”

segments.pli: “Yassa nūna, āvuso sāriputta, evamassa:
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, there may be an impairment in body or deterioration of faculties for someone who thinks:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ cakkhūti vā mama cakkhūti vā … pe …
segments.en: ‘I am the eye’ or ‘the eye is mine.’

segments.pli: ahaṃ jivhāti vā mama jivhāti vā …
segments.en: Or ‘I am the ear … nose … tongue … body …’

segments.pli: ahaṃ manoti vā mama mano’ti vā.
segments.en: Or ‘I am the mind’ or ‘the mind is mine.’

segments.pli: Tassa, āvuso sāriputta, siyā kāyassa vā aññathattaṃ indriyānaṃ vā vipariṇāmo.
Mayhañca kho, āvuso sāriputta, na evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: But I don’t think like that.

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ cakkhūti vā mama cakkhūti vā … pe …
ahaṃ jivhāti vā mama jivhāti vā … pe …
ahaṃ manoti vā mama manoti vā’.
Tassa mayhañca kho, āvuso sāriputta, kiṃ kāyassa vā aññathattaṃ bhavissati, indriyānaṃ vā vipariṇāmo”ti.
segments.en: So why would there be an impairment in my body or deterioration of my faculties?”

segments.pli: Tathā hi panāyasmato upasenassa dīgharattaṃ ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānānusayo susamūhato.
segments.en: “That must be because Venerable Upasena has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.

segments.pli: Tasmā āyasmato upasenassa na evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: That’s why it doesn’t occur to you:

segments.pli: “‘ahaṃ cakkhūti vā mama cakkhūti vā … pe …
segments.en: ‘I am the eye’ or ‘the eye is mine.’ Or ‘I am the ear …

segments.pli: ahaṃ jivhāti vā mama jivhāti vā … pe …
segments.en: nose … tongue … body …’

segments.pli: ahaṃ manoti vā mama mano’ti vā”ti.
segments.en: Or ‘I am the mind’ or ‘the mind is mine.’”

segments.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmato upasenassa kāyaṃ mañcakaṃ āropetvā bahiddhā nīhariṃsu.
segments.en: Then those mendicants lifted Upasena’s body onto a cot and carried it outside.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmato upasenassa kāyo tattheva vikiri;
segments.en: And his body was scattered right there

segments.pli: seyyathāpi bhusamuṭṭhīti.
segments.en: like a handful of chaff.

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the venerables Sāriputta and Upasena were…

suttaplex.blurb: A viper bit Venerable Upasena, but he remained poised, declaring that he had no identification with the six senses.
